channel.title: cybersecurity on Matt Evans
channel.description: Recent content in cybersecurity on Matt Evans

item.title: The Future of Cybersecurity Consulting
item.description: I don’t know what the future of cybersecurity consulting will be, but I have some thoughts. Back in the late 1900s, cybersecurity wasn’t really a thing. To the extent that it was, it was owned by a very small group who were both techy and a little naughty in the νοῦς, as they say. A typical cybersecurity engagement involved rocking up to a customer, him giving you a cable, and you going at it for love and money, getting pwns every which way before lunch.

item.title: What Will AI Not Consume? Strategically Placing Oneself For the New Era.
item.description: AI is not just a buzzword. To be sure, as to the words, it is nonsense: there is no intelligence, but mere pattern matching and extrapolation. Well, call that intelligence if you will; I won’t. But the effects of AI cannot be downplayed and should not be ignored by anyone in a technical discipline not wanting to be left behind. If you work in any of these industries, I believe it’s very possible that AI is coming to eat your lunch:
